channel.title: Comments on: Welcome to My Bunker Hill

item.title: By: Alexis Shoemaker
item.dc:creator: Alexis Shoemaker
item.content:encoded:
A friend of mine sent me pictures of Old Los Angeles over 10 years ago, because he knew that I was born in Los Angeles. Â One picture stoped me in my tracks, and It was “The Castle”! Â I could swear I had seen it some where before and I can’t put my finger on it. Â  I have been obsessed with trying to find out who the original architect wasÂ for the floor plan lay-out was before the add-ons. Â Would you have any idea of who it is? Or who they are?

Old Los Angeles has been my muse for all my art projects while I attended the local college.

item.title: By: Christopher Ekman
item.dc:creator: Christopher Ekman
item.description: It's very sad how much of Los Angeles's historic buildings and houses have been lost. The city needs to care more about preserving it' s nineteenth century architecture.
item.content:encoded: It’s very sad how much of Los Angeles’s historic buildings and houses have been lost. The city needs to care more about preserving it’ s nineteenth century architecture.
